c74object.name: bach.cross
c74object.digest: Compute the cross product of two lllls
c74object.description: Computes the cross product (or vector product) of two lllls having 3 coordinates.

method.name: bang
method.description: Outputs the cross product of the most recently received input data.

method.name: llll
method.description: An llll in the first inlet sets the left vector and outputs the result. An llll in the second inlet sets the right vector.

attribute.name: out
attribute.description:
The out attribute is a sequence of characters identifying the outlet types (one character for each llll outlet). Characters can be one of the following:
n (default): 'native' output: faster and more precise between bach objects, but unreadable by standard Max objects (an "bach.llll" message appears instead).
t: 'text' output: slower and limited in size, but readable by standard Max objects. A plain llll in text format is a generic Max message. To keep the representation invertible (i.e., to allow a bach object receiving a text-format llll to interpret it exactly as if it was native format, e

c74object.discussion: The cross product is only defined in the three-dimensional cartesian space, thus both lllls are expected to have 3 coordinates.
